caption: I had the chance to visit here for my birthday this year. Absolutely delicious food. I'm still thinking about it months later. The business was incredibly clean, and the chef/owner of the business that we spoke too was very hospitable. I …
The lady server was very rude. Not at all acceptable. Not worth a visit.
Some of the best Indian food in Houston. Chef Sunil and his team deliver delicious, complex flavors and excellent service.
It was my first time visiting this place, ambiance and service was amazing. Food was class apart. My favorite was the Biryani, gosht ki gilawat, goat cheese ke kebab and shrimp coconut shrimp curry.

A must visit when in Houston! The food, the ambiance, the drinks, the owners - everything about this place is awesome and one of a kind experience. You can’t go wrong with any choice either in appetizers or cocktails, main food or desserts!

This restaurant is very classy and both food and service are excellent. I love Indian food, and I had the opportunity to have it many times in India and around the world. Verandah reminds me of the best places I have been in Mumbai, with the sophisticated touch of a Houstonian restaurant. You have to try it!

One of the best in the USA according to me, definitely try kolhapuri if you can handle real spice, biriyani and what not, every dish has an angle, it’s just if you are up for what it stands for.  It doesn’t have to be the same that you’ve tasted else where, it just has make you say, “wow am thrilled to be here overall”.

I've had the wonderful opportunity to have a wide selection of Indian food around the world in my life and I've just got to say - Verandah is in the top 3, anywhere.  I simply cannot express the sheer delight of every single item that we …
A+
Enjoyed the ambience and food.
Very delicious food, nice ambience, great service.

Eating at a restaurant is not just about food, one can cook good food at home too, it’s about the overall experience and particularly the hospitality. And thats where Verandah lacks the most, hospitality. They lack hospitality so much that …

We had a fantastic meal yesterday. The food was great - awesome taste, perfect spice and presentation was beautiful. Chef Sunil and Anupama were good hosts and have built a great restaurant. Thank you.

Food was not good, small portions, and over priced. Won’t ever be back. ☹️  The butter chicken portion was fine but the taste was not, did not taste like butter chicken.  The rice portion was a bit small, as well as the kheer. Wasn’t worth $49 ijs.
Went today with my friends and family and was humiliated by the service. I had to wait two hours for my food...

Terrible customer service, has cockroaches, had a fly on my rice, their restrooms are infested with mold, and had a terrible stench in there. Let me give you a hint! It might be the rats that I heard squealing on their roof. There are …

Visited this place for my Birthday dinner. Being aware about high end Indian restaurants like this in Houston, which are very specific how they cater the guests, I called in advance for a reservation and prior to confirming asked if my 30 …

This place is AMAZING. A must try for sure. VERY vegan friendly. The wait staff was superb. They asked about dietary restrictions immediately and were happy to accommodate. Our entire group was blown away with the amazing service AND …

Where do I begin? 1. The interior design is clean, modern, with elements inspired by the four energy sources in Ayurveda. Please go to the bathroom to witness more noteworthy  warm, sophisticated ambience. 2. Every dish we tried was unique …
This place is absolutely one of my favorites. The service was very sociable and kind. The bill was reasonable.

We stumbled upon Verandah earlier this year, and gosh! were we thrilled to finally find a progressive Indian restaurant in Houston that also provides warm, personal service. There are of course other fine dining Indian restaurants, but I …

The place is upscale, the food is extremely flavorful, and authentic. Will be going back  Update: We've visited a few times now and cannot say enough about how good the food is here! Chef Sunil is a true master of his art. I need to add …

Excellent food and decor. Dined here last night and was blown off with the quality and presentation of food. Staff was very professional and attentive. Great service, made us very comfortable through out our dinner. All the staff were …
Amazing restaurant! You can tell that the chef and staff arepare about making sure everyone who comes in enjoys their time and their food. Beautiful plating and everything we ordered tasted amazing!!
Was not allowed entry due to dress code restrictions. Sorry, not coming back.
Awesome easily the best Indian restaurant in Houston
Service was terrible, the manager kept bugging us to order more items. I should've checked other reviews before coming here, plenty others have complained about the service.
Food is good but bit pricey
The owners of this beautiful restaurant are such gracious hosts & more importantly, the food is out-of -this-world delicious. We’ll be back soon! I can’t recommend Verandah highly enough!
We enjoyed the food, ambience and attentive waiter. Lots of great vegetarian dishes. Meat dishes very tasty too.

Terrible service. Maybe the experience was unique as it was a prefix Valentines Day menu. I didnt like my drink and requested if I could select a different drink. I was told that the drink was already made and that nothing more was said. …
What a restaurant, Just wow. Salute to Chef Sunil’s creativity what an ambiance, great quality food. My favorite Kalongi Baigan and Daal Makhni. Was just out of the world.
Well thought out Menu. Simply delicious food. Excellent service. Ambience Super.

Where to begin? The place was easy to find, and from the moment you enter the restaurant you're struck by the intimate ambience and the delicious smells of food. We started with drinks, and their mocktails and cocktails aren't extensive but …

An upscale Indian eatery with a pleasant ambience. The cocktails though concocted from casual Indian drinks are not all that great. The food was ok but nothing extraordinary. The manager was very courteous and nice but the person in charge …

The food was very flavorful and they refill your drinks when it becomes half.  We went for our end of the year meeting, and spent 2 hours there, best to go when you have time to savor all the unique delicious flavors.  My favorite was the coconut curry vegetables.
Overpriced and bad service.
Nice and decent place to have some good food with authentic indian dishes

We visited verandah restaurant for lunch and had a good experience. We tried their curry dishes with both veg and non veg option. Food was delicious with good flavor , manager was attentive, ambience is good. Overall a good place to try Indian food.

1 Star for dress code. I don't see how this restaurant will be successful long term with these types of clothing restrictions. There are amazing indian restaurants in the area and tonight was the night I was planning to give this restaurant …

This place is awesome. We went with a 14 people party and they served us pretty well. Food was awesome and service was also great. They even packed the boxes for us for the leftovers very gracefully which most restaurants don't do. I would highly recommend this place. And yes, there is a business casual dress code so please follow that.

I have been to Veranda twice. The first time we went I went there was with my husband and kids - 3 year and 11 month old. The manager told us that they don't have a high chair but if we want to still come and eat we are more than happy to. …

One of the best Indian restaurants EVER!!! I have known both Chef Sunil and his wife, Anu for the past 15 years from the beginning at Meadows Place to their restaurant in the Energy Corridor to this upscale Kirby location. They are both …

Last week I visited this place after reading reviews, with my office colleague.  This is a modern Indian restaurant and with a very good taste of  Indian food. I have been to many Indian restaurants in the Houston area, I would say it is …

Absolutely loved the place!!Verandah is a very modern restaurant. We loved the ambience, decor and the positive vibes of the place. The food was awesome starting from the presentation , to the portion size and the taste.The staff was very …

This is certainly a beautiful treat of a restaurant with delicious, creatively presented dishes. I’ve been for lunch twice and for dinner, specifically for our anniversary. The chef surprised us with one of the best desserts I’ve ever …
Food was wonderful and service was excellent. Very nice so don't show up in flip flops and a t shirt
One of my new Favorite places.

Upscale intimate Indian dining. I have never experienced better Indian cuisine in my life. It far exceeded my expectations. The atmosphere was great, the staff was excellent, and each dish was delicious. My only regret is now I will be disappointed every time I have Indian anywhere else.

Absolutely amazing twist to Modern Indian Food! Chef very friendly and accommodating to diet restrictions. Best Indian Food I have ever enjoyed eating. I would highly recommend. Atmosphere is welcoming and decorated gorgeously.
Phenomenal presentation of all the dishes, friendly service, good for a large party of 12. I'd highly recommend the place to all my desi friends

Recently we visited a restaurant call Verandah on Kirby. I was denied a service there by their manager because I had a baby with me in stroller. We went there around 1:45 PM on a Saturday and restaurant was empty, there were only 2 tables …
This restaurant denies service to patrons who have children with them; FYI it's not listed anywhere on their website or Yelp that they don't allow children!!
Ohh, restaurant denying service with kids? Good luck attracting the right audience for your high end restaurant if you are not treating everyone equally.
Sounds like if you have kids your not welcome here ...

This my first time to a high-end Indian restaurant. I was impressed by initially by the decor and as usual I was skeptical about great looking restaurants when it comes to quality of food and service. I was pleasantly surprised by the …
This is the type of Indian food I truly enjoy, it’s not too oily or spicy just a perfect combination of spices and cooked to perfection. Must try the sea bass curry!

Absolutely loved the place! From the wonderful service from all of their staff to their exceptional mouth watering food, my family and I had an amazing experience! Would definitely recommend it! The interior of the restaurant is beautiful along with the presentation of their food! The quality was very nice! We had a lovely family time!

One of the best Indian upscale restaurant. Best interior Best food presentation Best taste One of the best place to visit if you want to introduce Indian food to anyone. The staff was friendly and welcoming.

This intimate and cozy restaurant is locate in the kirby area.  It seats about 60, with small tables for seats and has an extensive menu for indian food items.  The service is quite good, with about 3 servers who are polite and efficient …

Hands down the best Indian restaurant. The executive chef has been making amazing dishes for years and his new location did not disappoint. The ambiance is properly upscale, the staff sweats all the details and the food is about perfect. …
Impressed! Definitely returning to enjoy more of this menu!

Wonderful service from the staff here. Lots of people complaining about being discriminated for not coming in their dress code of business casual or not having waiters come to their table every second should stop. Follow the rules of a …

Food is just OK. They are “trying” to be an upscale restaurant but haven’t yet figured things out.  Too many waiters coming by yet no one can get anything you ask for. Took three different waiters to get us a straw.  If they want to be an …

Customer service is really bad . Manager and server have no respect for customer . We went on Friday evening at 6:00 . Whole restaurant was empty , still they behaved so snobbishly and turned us away before making snide remarks that we are …

Verandah is the fine example of what happens when a restaurant owner attempts to launch something upscale without considering whether it feels forced. Although several of the dishes that my wife and I sampled were well prepared and tasty, …
Great service and decor; Nan is warm and food is tasty.

Finally, Chefs Sunil and Anupama have a restaurant that does justice to their talent! We went there for lunch on Saturday and had a meal that delighted the senses. The food was delicious and tastefully presented, reminiscent of the …
Very good food and service. Very expensive. Parking is difficult and making a reservation even more challenging.

Price was too high for the quality of food and service. They took the cutleries away while I was still eating my food. I would recommend other Indian restaurants around that area which are much better in quality and price.

Worst restaurant in Houston. Service wise it even makes Himalayas look like a super-star. The audacious, arrogant, good for nothing, useless manager thinks that by putting up an unnatural American accent he can appease the crowd and fit in. …

One star only because I can't give them a negative star!... We were impolitely refused service for not keeping up with their "dress code" in the 21st century when a Caucasian individual was at the bar in shorts! I've never come across this racist a restaurant in Houston. Shame on you, Verandah. And grow up!
Excellent food, nice customer service. Tested three course menu during Houston Restaurant Weeks, appetizer portion was too small but overall great expey. They validate parking for 2 hours.
Outstanding experience overall. The food was delicious, the presentation artful and the service was excellent. One of the negative reviews complained about having to valet park.  Really ?
Bad service
Simply the best Indian food in Htown. The chef’s passion can be seen in every dish served!
Great food , great service

I have been a regular a Verandah since they moved inside the loop. This isn't your regular Indian food. Chef Sunil brings fine dining Indian rustic meal to your table with a polish very few can accomplish. It is definitely fine dining (can …

This review has been pending for a long time. I write reviews only if the restaurant is really bad or really good. Me and my husband have always liked the owner's previous restaurant - Wakhana Express. With very high expectations we went …
Amazing food !!!
Awesome food and awesome service
The food is excellent and add great ambiance,  awesome service to it nd u have a winner

I would give it 0 stars if I could, I understand it is upscale dining, but there was no one in the restaurant. We were turned away because we weren't dressed up, at 5 p.m on a Saturday and also because we had a baby. We had to ask where to …

This is a lovely restaurant! Great ambiance, beautifully decorated and comfortable. The food is exquisite. Indian fare done to perfection, in taste and presentation. The owners are attentive and warm. Honestly, you just can’t go wrong. We loved it!

A great addition to the Indian cuisine restaurants of Houston.   The food is excellent with attentive service.  It is a little pricier than typical Indian restaurants in Houston but the food quality and flavors is far superior to the …

So disappointed. They have lost my business. Called and made reservations for 8:30 pm. We were running 15 minutes late so we called to let them know. Arrived at 8:45 pm and called to get help finding exactly where they were located. Finally …

The food is excellent. Do NOT skip the naan because of some weird fear of carbs. It is heavenly. Sleek, relaxing atmosphere. Great service. Location is a bit odd. Hard to see sign from the street because a tree blocks line of sight. Just …
One of the upscale Indian restaurant in Houston which makes you visit for their innovative dishes. Ordered the tasting menu where Mr. Sunil got us unconventional dishes which tasted good as well.

We've been fans of Chef Sunil's food since the Great W'kana days on Airport Blvd and he continues to excel at Verandah as well. We tried the 5 course tasting menu and it was brilliant. Chef Sunil, also made modifications for me (Celiac anddairy free). And absolutely love the pretty decor as well.

The complimentary dish was not fresh.  The food was ok.  It felt like the fish only had garam masala on it.  The tables are too narrow for plates to be kept comfortably.  And I was disappointed that while they validated my parking ticket I …

Food was excellent. However service was terrible. Once the meal was served no one checked on us. We were waiting to order desserts but after an hour were told you will have to leave as you have been at the table for one and half hours!! The place has potential but desperately needs good and trained staff.

Some of the best Indian food in Houston. More importantly, an Indian restaurant with incredible service. Great for all occasions - business, family, fun. I highly recommend Verandah for anyone looking for a great restaurant with great food and great ambiance.

First time here and will never return again and wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I would give this place a zero rating if I could.  Terrible  service and took us over an hour just to get appetizers and drinks. Avoid this place at all costs. They charge premium prices but have terrible service.

Our first time here but not impressed with their service. Despite reserving a table for 4, it was set up for only 2. After being sitted we had to ask for menus and extra silverware. Took over an hour to get appetizers and drinks. Long story …

This place is horrible. We maxd reservations for a table for 4 and our table was only plated for 2. It took us 20 minutes to just get courtesy water glasses for the other two. The server, Naveen, was very slow and not attentive to us. Once …
Sunil Srivatsava is the most creative chef for Indian cuisine in Houston
Excellent food very good service

I wanted to take this opportunity to voice an opinion for the most finest Indian restaurant in Houston that we have ever come across. The acquaintance started several years ago, when they were initially located on Airport Blvd near Sugar …
The food is amazing! There seen to be a few new restaurant hiccups, but I think that will get better with time!
Outstanding food!!!

Amazing food!!! Elegant atmosphere. My go-to for any power lunch or romantic dinner.  I always order Chef Sunil’s chicken, as he does it better than anyone in town. Never dry. Always juicy and tasty!  The drinks are unique derivations on classics. The dishes are superb.

Heading to a newly opened Indian restaurant in heavy rain just to get worst experience. Could have given 0 if zero was allowed. 1) No one to greet at front desk for 5 mins. Haven't got that experience any where till date. 2) Few occupied …

The food was even better than and with new options from Great W'Kana, this restaurant's predecessor. We loved the goat biryani, and the duck.  We tried a few paneer (cheese) dishes. All excellent. Chef Sunil hasn't missed a beat. And the new physical restaurant is gorgeous. Go!!

I had heard great things about this place, so I wanted to check it out.  Everything was outstanding, especially the lamb shank, curry chicken, beet appetizer, and the cocktails. We tried 3 different cocktails - one with tamarind and …
Great food and cocktails!
Very delicious food with elegant style in an amazing atmosphere. I would like to come again and again. :-)
awesome spot. Great service and the food is excellent. Won’t disappoint. 5 stars. #HTown

Excellent food, service, ambiance, and cocktails.  Mix of traditional and creative dishes and drinks.  It's a bit pricier than other Indian places around, but justified by the increased quality and aesthetics.  Highly recommend making a reservation before going.  Easy parking around back of the building and on the side-streets.
A must eat at restaurant. The food is the best Indian food in Houston.  We enjoy Sunil's (the Chef) hospitality.. no two dishes taste alike!
Food was amazing.  Staff was amazing and the place was very clean.    We will be coming back on a regular basis.    This is a must try!!

This place is great. The food was delicious. The quality of the ingredients and the effort in preparation reminded me of other 'upscale' Indian restaurants in the area. The ambiance was chic. The service was attentive. I will definitely be back.
Fantastic food and great staff! Pricey, but worth the money.

New restaurant in Houston. Food quality is excellent. Ambience is up scale and good for evening dinner. Different options and old things in new way and various style of traditional food. Service is good but may vary depending on rush. Overall good place for quite evening.

A gourmet meal dished out on your plate as you are seated on comfortable white chairs. They also seen to have gone green with No linen on the table  but clean glossy white table tops. The ambience soft and soothing and the wine served with …
The food was really good. Way fancier than I expected. We had the lamb and the samosas. Should have ordered the lassie!
We used to visit their restaurant when they were on briar forest drive and loved their food... This new place is much better than that
The food and presentation  is Par excellence !! Do visit , you’ll be returning more than you think:)

We had an event for our Non Profit and they did an amazing job with all the Appetizers. The Appetizers were specially created for our event and the personal touch went a long way. The quality of food and the presentation was AWESOME.

One of the finest indian restaurants i have been to. Some of their dishes really remind me of home, especially the mutton chukka and kerala shrimps. Can order any dish from here closing your eyes, there is no compromise on taste. Really love this place!!!
Hands down the best Indian restaurant!!!! Love this place and the people !

Glad to be the first reviewer of this mind blowing fine dining restaurant by Chef Sunil serving the best authentic Indian food in the US. I have been to indian restaurants in more than 10 states serving 20+ curries with same red color base, …
